thread.title: SPORTS: Locals enjoy success at annual Masters Games
thread.title_full: SPORTS: Locals enjoy success at annual Masters Games

author: Staff Reports
title: SPORTS: Locals enjoy success at annual Masters Games
text:
SPORTS: Locals enjoy success at annual Masters Games Staff Reports cullmantimes.com 
A local quartet collected state championships at the Masters Games last week in Oxford. 
Fred Ponder, Charles White, Wade Casey and Harry Chandler all took top honors at the 25th annual event, which featured more than 500 seniors. 
Ponder was the man to beat in free-throw shooting for his age group, sinking 25 of 30 attempts at the charity stripe. 
White was the free-throw king for his division, making 21 of 30 tries. 
Casey won the golf competition with an 80 at Cider Ridge Golf Club. 
Last but not least is Chandler, 84, who was victorious at table tennis. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
